title: Ticket #1485: Bad schedd cron argument is checked for incorrectly in condor_submit
description:
In SetCronTab() in condor_submit.V6/submit.cpp, the CronTab attributes are validated incorrectly. 

if ( ! CronTab::validateParameter( ctr, param, error ) ) {
	fprintf( stderr, "ERROR: %s\n", error.Value() );
	DoCleanup( 0, 0, NULL );
	exit( 1 );
}

CronTab::validateParameter() needs CronTab::regex to be initialized, otherwise regex.match() returns false. In this case CronTab::regex is unitialized and the validate fails to catch any problems. 

bool
Regex::match(const MyString & string,
			 ExtArray<MyString> * groups)
{
	if ( ! this->isInitialized() ) {
		return false;
	}
